New Records: LeBron James became the first player in NBA history to appear in a game in his teens and 40s.
Key Match Events: Jarrett Allen scored a season-high 27 points.
Austin Reaves had a season-high 35 points with 10 assists and nine rebounds.
Anthony Davis added 28 points and 13 rebounds.
Dorian Finney-Smith and Shake Milton made their Los Angeles debuts after being acquired in a trade with Brooklyn.
Cleveland led 96-80 less than three minutes into the fourth quarter before Los Angeles started to rally.
The Lakers got within 112-107 before the Cavaliers closed the game on a 10-3 run.
Allen's dunk with 1:58 remaining gave Cleveland a 116-107 advantage, putting it out of reach.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers made 18 3-pointers, the seventh straight game they have had at least that many from beyond the arc.
Others: Sam Merrill sprained his right ankle during the second quarter and did not return.
Darius Garland had a season-high 14 assists.
The Cavaliers wrap up their road trip at Dallas on Friday, while the Lakers host Portland on Thursday.
